project.teaser: The mission of INPACE is to actively support the implementation of the Digital Partnerships with Japan, the Republic of Korea, and Singapore, and the cooperation with India in the context of the Trade and Technology Council, by creating a sustainable and interactive...
project.objective: The mission of INPACE is to actively support the implementation of the Digital Partnerships with Japan, the Republic of Korea, and Singapore, and the cooperation with India in the context of the Trade and Technology Council, by creating a sustainable and interactive multi-stakeholder Indo-Pacific European Hub. The INPACE Hub is organised in 3 pillars: Policy (Activity Cluster 1 - Digital Dialogues, Policy and Education), rolling out digital technologies (Activity Cluster 2 - Innovation and Entrepreneurship for Sustainable Well-being), and pushing key technologies forward (Clusters 3 - Trustworthy Decision Support, 4 - Chips of the Future and 5 - Future Networks). The Hub will create a INPACE Community Platform to support the implementation of Digital Partnerships in the Indo-Pacific. A key element of INPACE is to organise thematically focused discussions on the expert level in 17 areas of strategic interest in Thematic Working Groups. This will lead to detailed and strategic outputs based on analytical work and deep domain knowledge. 28 events, both thematic and integrated, will provide networking opportunities. INPACE combines three levels of interventions, feeding each other: the expert level, the government level, the broader community of stakeholders. INPACE integrates co-creation, stakeholder engagement, community building. Particular attention is given to the impact and implications of digital technologies from the social and humanistic point of view. Regular communications with the EC and policy makers will ensure compatibility with ongoing efforts and priorities. It will also be assured, through the Asian partners, that the counterparts in the partner countries are informed and supportive of the activities. INPACE will from the start embed sustainability in the project execution, aiming at the hub becoming a sustainable long-term expert-driven mechanism for EU-Indo-Pacific collaboration in Digital Technologies and possibly beyond.
project.title: Indo-Pacific-European Hub for Digital Partnerships: Trusted Digital Technologies for Sustainable Well-Being
project.keywords: EU-Indo-Pacific, Digital Partnerships, Evidence-based Policy Support, Community Platform, R&I, Trusted Technologies, Industrial, Trade, Collaboration, Entrepreneurship, Well-being, Co-creation

article.title: Closing the digital gap in EU-Asia collaboration

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - INPACE (Indo-Pacific-European Hub for Digital Partnerships: Trusted Digital Technologies for Sustainable Well-Being)
result.teaser: The mission of the INPACE project – “Indo-Pacific-European Hub for Digital Partnerships: Trusted Digital Technologies for Sustainable Well Being” - is to establish a sustainable hub, fostering dialogue, innovation and trust in digital technologies, supporting the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: The INPACE Hub: types of stakeholders
The structure of the Clusters and the Thematic Working Groups

result.title: One summary Panorama report 1 report per Cluster with 4 partners country reports combined
result.description: The panorama report describes state of matters, R&D directions, strengths and weaknesses related to the TWG topics, covering Europe and the 4 Asian countries. It combines cluster level reports to be provided by each cluster leader. These reports are built using the TWG factsheets and include a cluster level synthesis for Europe and each of the Asian countries. This panorama report will be used in consultation session.

result.title: Toolbox and Roadmap for the realisation of the Hub
result.description: The INPACE Toolbox will include collection of public summaries and methodological materials provided by different consortium partners: 1) summary of INPACE for the public use (D4P), 2) ToR for experts (GAC); 3) structure of the Hub and guidance materials for all Clusters and all TWGs (EGM) 4) Guidelines for TWG’s engagement strategy (D4P); 5) Messages for policy makers about the Hub (VUB), 6) overview of integrative activities (GAC), (7) guide about the empowering work (SPI), (8) community platform info-sheet (EG). A short public summary of the Roadmap (EG, support by GAC) for the creation of the INPACE Hub will be also part of this deliverable.

result.title: Community Platform Public Summary Initial
result.description: This deliverable presents the initial version of the INPACE platform: its detailed features, targeted audience and how users are engaged in the tool. It also provides usage statistics, which will be also consolidated in D5.2. The platform user guide (by EG) and summary and guidance about the InfoAsset use by people registered on the platform (by ATC) will be provided in annex of this document.

result.title: Summary of desk research and interviews and survey and consultation Initial
result.description: A concise summary capturing the actions taken concerning desk research, interviews, and consultations conducted in WP4. It provides a snapshot of expert insights across domains of TWGs, the evolution of Digital Partnerships, and the evidence-based materials shaping the Opportunity Report. The document also points to major findings from the surveys, key topics of interest for public consultations, and offers a glance at the preliminary feedback on Panorama and Opportunity Reports. The report will be developed initially at M12, and updated every 12 months (M24, M36).

result.title: Report on synergies and commonalities in policies strategies and programmes between the EU and PC
result.description: A comprehensive report detailing the alignment and commonalities between EU and Partner Country policies, strategies, and programmes. It highlights major areas of synergies, potential avenues for collaboration, key policy developments and standardization approaches, and provides a deep dive into the current status of Digital Partnerships and TTC. The report also offers insights on potential stakeholders and international bodies that can influence cooperative strategies.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
